t: Revelation 3
To the Church in Sardis

“To*rp the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Sardis*r write:*r These*rln are*r the*r words*r of*r him*r who*r holds*r the*r seven*r spirits*r of*r God*r and*r the*r seven*r stars.*r I*r know*r your*r deeds;*r you*r have*r a*r reputation*r of*r being*r alive,*r but*r you*r are*r dead.*r
Wake*r up!*r Strengthen*r what*r remains*r and*r is*r about*r to*r die,*r for*r I*r have*r found*r your*r deeds*r unfinished*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r my*r God.*r

Remember,*r therefore,*r what*r you*r have*r received*r and*r heard;*r hold*r it*r fast,*r and*r repent.*r But*r if*r you*r do*r not*r wake*r up,*r I*r will*r come*r like*r a*r thief,*r and*r you*r will*r not*r know*r at*r what*r time*r I*r will*r come*r to*r you.*r
Yet*rln you*r have*r a*r few*r people*r in*r Sardis*r who*r have*r not*r soiled*r their*r clothes.*r They*r will*r walk*r with*r me,*r dressed*r in*r white,*r for*r they*r are*r worthy.*r

The*r one*r who*r is*r victorious*r will,*r like*r them,*r be*r dressed*r in*r white.*r I*r will*r never*r blot*r out*r the*r name*r of*r that*r person*r from*r the*r book*r of*r life,*r but*r will*r acknowledge*r that*r name*r before*r my*r Father*r and*r his*r angels.*r
Whoever*r has*r ears,*r let*r them*r hear*r what*r the*r Spirit*r says*r to*r the*r churches.*r
To the Church in Philadelphia

“To*rp the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Philadelphia*r write:*r These*rln are*r the*r words*r of*r him*r who*r is*r holy*r and*r true,*r who*r holds*r the*r key*r of*r David.*r What*r he*r opens*r no*r one*r can*r shut,*r and*r what*r he*r shuts*r no*r one*r can*r open.*r

I*r know*r your*r deeds.*r See,*r I*r have*r placed*r before*r you*r an*r open*r door*r that*r no*r one*r can*r shut.*r I*r know*r that*r you*r have*r little*r strength,*r yet*r you*r have*r kept*r my*r word*r and*r have*r not*r denied*r my*r name.*r

I*r will*r make*r those*r who*r are*r of*r the*r synagogue*r of*r Satan,*r who*r claim*r to*r be*r Jews*r though*r they*r are*r not,*r but*r are*r liars—I*r will*r make*r them*r come*r and*r fall*r down*r at*r your*r feet*r and*r acknowledge*r that*r I*r have*r loved*r you.*r

Since*r you*r have*r kept*r my*r command*r to*r endure*r patiently,*r I*r will*r also*r keep*r you*r from*r the*r hour*r of*r trial*r that*r is*r going*r to*r come*r on*r the*r whole*r world*r to*r test*r the*r inhabitants*r of*r the*r earth.*r
I*rln am*r coming*r soon.*r Hold*r on*r to*r what*r you*r have,*r so*r that*r no*r one*r will*r take*r your*r crown.*r

The*r one*r who*r is*r victorious*r I*r will*r make*r a*r pillar*r in*r the*r temple*r of*r my*r God.*r Never*r again*r will*r they*r leave*r it.*r I*r will*r write*r on*r them*r the*r name*r of*r my*r God*r and*r the*r name*r of*r the*r city*r of*r my*r God,*r the*r new*r Jerusalem,*r which*r is*r coming*r down*r out*r of*r heaven*r from*r my*r God;*r and*r I*r will*r also*r write*r on*r them*r my*r new*r name.*r

To the Church in Laodicea
“To*rp the*r angel*r of*r the*r church*r in*r Laodicea*r write:*r These*rln are*r the*r words*r of*r the*r Amen,*r the*r faithful*r and*r true*r witness,*r the*r ruler*r of*r God’s*r creation.*r
I*r know*r your*r deeds,*r that*r you*r are*r neither*r cold*r nor*r hot.*r I*r wish*r you*r were*r either*r one*r or*r the*r other!*r
So,*r because*r you*r are*r lukewarm—neither*r hot*r nor*r cold—I*r am*r about*r to*r spit*r you*r out*r of*r my*r mouth.*r

You*r say,*r ‘I*r am*r rich;*r I*r have*r acquired*r wealth*r and*r do*r not*r need*r a*r thing.’*r But*r you*r do*r not*r realize*r that*r you*r are*r wretched,*r pitiful,*r poor,*r blind*r and*r naked.*r

Those*rln whom*r I*r love*r I*r rebuke*r and*r discipline.*r So*r be*r earnest*r and*r repent.*r

Here*r I*r am!*r I*r stand*r at*r the*r door*r and*r knock.*r If*r anyone*r hears*r my*r voice*r and*r opens*r the*r door,*r I*r will*r come*r in*r and*r eat*r with*r that*r person,*r and*r they*r with*r me.*r

To*rln the*r one*r who*r is*r victorious,*r I*r will*r give*r the*r right*r to*r sit*r with*r me*r on*r my*r throne,*r just*r as*r I*r was*r victorious*r and*r sat*r down*r with*r my*r Father*r on*r his*r throne.*r
